segment.source: About Using the Sequencer Command Line
segment.target: About Using the Sequencer Command Line

segment.source: About Using the Sequencer Command Line
segment.target: About Using the Sequencer Command Line

segment.source: About Using the Sequencer Command Line
segment.target: About Using the Sequencer Command Line

segment.source: You can use the command line to create sequenced application packages.
segment.target: You can use the command line to create sequenced application packages.

segment.source: Using the command line to create virtual applications is useful in the following scenarios:
segment.target: Using the command line to create virtual applications is useful in the following scenarios:

segment.source: You need to create a large number of sequenced application packages.
segment.target: You need to create a large number of sequenced application packages.

segment.source: You need to create a sequenced application package on a recurring basis.
segment.target: You need to create a sequenced application package on a recurring basis.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Sequencing at the command prompt allows for default sequencing only.
segment.target: Sequencing at the command prompt allows for default sequencing only.

segment.source: If you need to change default sequencing parameters, you must either manually modify a sequenced application package or re-sequence the application.
segment.target: If you need to change default sequencing parameters, you must either manually modify a sequenced application package or re-sequence the application.

segment.source: All subsequent modifications to existing sequenced application packages must be made using the sequencing wizard.
segment.target: All subsequent modifications to existing sequenced application packages must be made using the sequencing wizard.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: To sequence an application by using the command prompt, the following conditions must be met:
segment.target: To sequence an application by using the command prompt, the following conditions must be met:

segment.source: The application that is about to be sequenced must not require changes or workarounds made to it outside the installer or Windows Installer package.
segment.target: The application that is about to be sequenced must not require changes or workarounds made to it outside the installer or Windows Installer package.

segment.source: Before sequencing, you must prepare a list of batch files for creating the sequenced application packages.
segment.target: Before sequencing, you must prepare a list of batch files for creating the sequenced application packages.

segment.source: Review For more information about the command line parameters, see Command-Line Parameters.
segment.target: Review For more information about the command line parameters, see Command-Line Parameters.

segment.source: Review the errors that might be displayed when creating a sequenced application package by using the command line.
segment.target: Review the errors that might be displayed when creating a sequenced application package by using the command line.

segment.source: For more information, see these errors, see Command-Line Errors.
segment.target: For more information, see these errors, see Command-Line Errors.

segment.target: Related topics
